page.title: 04Keele-a university village
page.content: Keele lies on the A525 between Madeley and Newcastle-Under-Lyme,and close to the M6 Motorway. Most of the houses in the village were built before 1938, and a few were built in the late 1800s.The build up of traffic on the A525 has proved to be a source of great danger and plans for a by-pass have been recently put forward. An old yew tree stands in the centre of the village at the junction of 2 roads. Keele Hall,once the home of the Sneyd Family,is now part of the University of Keele.There are large residential halls for students,both here and in Keele village.The university population is very fluid with families moving after relatively short periods.The village population is fairly static consisting of families who have lived in Keele for generations.
